title: OSHA Job Safety and Health Poster
summary: All employers must display the OSHA poster informing workers of their rights to a safe workplace and how to report hazards.

title: Department of Labor Workplace Posters
summary: Businesses need to post various DOL notices covering topics like minimum wage, overtime, and family medical leave to keep employees informed of their rights.

title: Equal Employment Opportunity Poster
summary: Employers must display the EEO poster to inform employees about protections against discrimination in the workplace.

title: Federal Minimum Wage Notice
summary: Post the federal minimum wage notice to let employees know the current minimum pay rate and overtime rules.

title: OSHA Safety Training Requirements
summary: Provide safety training to employees on workplace hazards and how to avoid them, as required by OSHA standards.

title: Family and Medical Leave Act Poster
summary: Display the FMLA poster to explain employees' rights to unpaid leave for family or medical reasons.

title: USERRA Military Leave Poster
summary: Post the USERRA notice to inform employees of their rights regarding military service and job protection.

title: Employee Polygraph Protection Act Poster
summary: Display this poster to let employees know they can't be required to take lie detector tests in most cases.

title: Obtain Employer Identification Number
summary: All businesses with employees must get an EIN from the IRS for tax purposes and reporting.

title: Child Labor Laws Notice
summary: Post information on federal child labor laws to ensure minors are not employed in hazardous jobs or excessive hours.

title: OSHA General Duty Clause
summary: Maintain a workplace free from serious recognized hazards, even if no specific standard applies.

title: Know Your Rights Poster Update
summary: Update the EEO poster to the new 'Know Your Rights' version as required by recent executive orders.

title: National Labor Relations Act Poster
summary: Inform employees of their rights to unionize and engage in collective bargaining.

title: OSHA Recordkeeping Requirements
summary: Keep records of work-related injuries and illnesses and post annual summaries.

title: Federal Tax Withholding Basics
summary: Withhold federal income taxes from employee wages and remit to the IRS.

title: Federal Business License if Applicable
summary: Obtain federal licenses for regulated industries like alcohol or firearms sales.

title: Additional OSHA Safety Posters
summary: Display industry-specific safety posters if required by OSHA regulations.

title: Federal Overtime Rules Notice
summary: Inform employees about overtime pay requirements under federal law.

title: New York Paid Sick Leave
summary: Provide up to 40 or 56 hours of paid sick leave per year depending on business size to allow employees time off for health needs.

title: New York Labor Law Posters
summary: Display state-required posters on minimum wage, discrimination, and workers' rights in the workplace.

title: Sales Tax Vendor Registration
summary: Register for a sales tax certificate if your business sells taxable goods or services in New York.

title: On-Premise Alcohol License
summary: Get a license to sell alcohol for consumption on your premises like a restaurant or bar.

title: Off-Premise Alcohol License
summary: Obtain a license to sell alcohol for consumption off your premises, such as in a liquor store.

title: Food Service Establishment Permit
summary: Apply for a permit to operate a food business ensuring compliance with health and safety standards.

title: Job Safety and Health Protection Poster
summary: Post the state safety and health poster to inform workers of their rights to a safe environment.

title: New York Minimum Wage Poster
summary: Display the current minimum wage rates for your region in New York.

title: Workers' Compensation Notice
summary: Provide notice of workers' compensation coverage to employees.

title: Unemployment Insurance Poster
summary: Post information on unemployment benefits for employees who lose their jobs.

title: Food Handler Certification
summary: Ensure food handlers complete certification for safe food preparation.

title: Alcohol Awareness Training
summary: Train staff on responsible alcohol service if selling alcohol.

title: Sales Tax on Food and Drink
summary: Collect and remit sales tax on sales of food and beverages.

title: Temporary Alcohol Permit for Events
summary: Get a permit for serving alcohol at off-premise events.

title: Retail Food Store License
summary: License required for stores selling food for off-premise consumption.

title: Compliance with Sanitary Code
summary: Follow state sanitary codes for food establishments to prevent health risks.

title: Electronic Labor Law Posters
summary: Make digital copies of required posters available on your website.

title: Off-Premises Catering License
summary: Obtain license for catering services at off-site locations.

title: Food Safety Inspections
summary: Prepare for regular inspections to ensure compliance with food safety rules.

summary: Follow wage and hour rules specific to industries like hospitality.

title: Alcohol Regulation Overview
summary: Understand and comply with state rules for alcohol beverage businesses.

title: SLA Licensing Changes
summary: Stay updated on changes to liquor license application procedures.

title: Workplace Laws for Employers
summary: Provide employees with required workplace law posters by specified dates.

title: Food from Approved Sources

title: Paid Sick Leave Notice
summary: Notify employees of their paid sick leave entitlements based on company size.

title: CPRA Privacy Rights

summary: Comply with CCPA by providing notices and responding to consumer requests about personal information.

title: Meal Break Requirements
summary: Provide a 30-minute unpaid meal break for shifts over 5 hours and a second for shifts over 10 hours.

title: Rest Break Rules
summary: Allow 10-minute paid rest breaks for every 4 hours worked.
